data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. So, the answer is No.

Turn around takes 4 steps. Take 4 steps and turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take right. So, the answer is No.

Turning around takes 8 steps in total. Thus, the answer is yes.

To return to the beginning point, you must take a turn. Therefore, the answer is yes.

The instructions make you turn left, then turn left after 5 steps. It took 15+ steps to do that for 10 steps to turn left. The instructions don't make you turn around before taking 5 steps. So, the answer is no.

Turn around, take 7 steps, turn around, turn around, take 7 steps and return back to the start point. So, the answer is yes.

The answer is no.

The instructions are given that the first 3 steps are forward. The final step is to take 1 step back. So, the answer is yes.

If you return to an starting point, you will always face forward. If you face left, you will always take 3 steps right. Similarly, if you face right, you will always take 3 steps right. So, the answer is No.

The starting point is found at the starting point. On the first step to the starting point, you go to its starting point. If you turn right towards the starting point, you turn right. So, the answer is Yes.

If you take 5 steps it only takes 5 steps to get to the starting point. If you take 3 steps it only takes 3 steps to get to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

The first 4 instructions don’ t say where to start. Taking 7 steps makes it back to your starting point. Thus, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps left. Take 2 steps right. Take 5 steps backward. Take 8 steps left. Take 7 steps forward. Take 7 steps right. Take 9 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
In order to return, you can either take 8 steps left or 9 steps forward. This is equal to 5 steps left + 7 steps right + 7 steps left. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps backward. Take 9 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
A person will never go backward unless instructed to do so. A person should be facing forward at all times. So, the answer is no.

Turning, taking 4 steps, is the same as turning, taking four steps. So, the answer is yes.

You always face forward when you take 6 steps. One right turn results in a number that is equal to 8 steps. Walking 6 steps left, you walk 6 steps right. So, the answer is No.

Turn right. Take five steps to turn around. Turn around. So, the answer is Yes.

You must always face forward in the instructions. Once you've played the video, you've now gained 2 steps backward. That means you mus not play the video again. So, the answer is no.

If you take 10 steps, then you take 10 steps. If you take 4 steps, then you take 4 steps. So, the answer is No.

Just because you take 9 steps, it does not mean you are returning to the starting point in a linear progression. So, the answer is it is not possible to tell.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 10 steps right. Take 7 steps backward. Take 3 steps left. Take 8 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you always face forward, you will never come back to the starting point. If you always face forward, you will always come back to the starting point. So, the answer is no.

The first step is when you were turned around the first time. The second step has 2 steps, the third step is when you went back to the starting point. So, the answer is no.

To face forward, one always faces forward. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 5 steps left. Take 1 step backward. Take 4 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 8 steps left. Take 6 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

You will not be able to take 6 steps left. You can't take backwards. You can't take reverse. You cannot take 5 steps left, backwards or both. You can only take 1 step left, backward, or both. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 3 steps forward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 7 steps left. Take 7 steps right. Take 8 steps backward. Take 4 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

The first step is from the starting point towards the place you started. The second step is from the starting point. The third step is from the starting point towards the place you started. If you are facing forward, in this second step you are facing away from the start point. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 8 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Turn around. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

In the first step you take 2 steps and the next one is 8 steps. The next step is 10 steps and the next one is 20 steps. In the first step and the next one, you are taking 10 steps. By the time you get back the first step is 20 steps. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps forward. Take 4 steps forward. Take 9 steps backward. Take 1 step backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

The first step backward is the first negative step that you take, so if you take 6 steps forward we go towards the first negative step, and so on. The 2nd step forward is the 2nd positive step that you take, so if you take4 steps forward we go towards the 2nd positive step. So, the answer is no.

Taking seven steps to reach the starting point indicates you would go backwards in time. Thus, the answer is no.

The instructions show the direction the step will take. It is either facing forward or facing backward but not both. There are no steps taken after taking the 4 steps backward. Thus, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 2 steps backward. Take 4 steps backward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
To go backward is to go in the opposite direction it was taking. To move forward is to move forward. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Turn left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn right on your way to the starting point. You did not take 10 steps to turn around. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps left. Take 8 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Take 4 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you always face forward, you continue to face forward on your trip from A to B to backward on your trip from C. We know that every person can always walk backward and have the same starting point. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 5 steps right. Take 4 steps backward. Take 8 steps left. Take 5 steps left. Take 6 steps backward. Take 9 steps forward. Take 5 steps right. Take 1 step forward. Take 3 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

You always start facing forward. You take the first 5 steps right, then take the next 5 steps left, then take the next 5 steps right, then take the next 5 steps left, then take the last 5 steps right, then take the last 5 steps right, and so on. Each move has an opposite direction. They also have different numbers of steps in their direction. They all add up to one number. You can never backtrack, and therefore cannot return to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps right. Take 1 step forward. Take 4 steps right. Take 4 steps left. Take 8 steps left. Take 2 steps forward. Take 9 steps forward. Take 3 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Each of these instructions can take you either in one direction or the other. If you are to do the next sequence from left to right, you would take 6*6 = 30 steps and go the wrong way around. Therefore, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You can’t take 9 steps without a 3 step back. So, the answer is Yes.

There are 5 steps left and you go left 8 steps right. So, the answer is No.

A person can only take 2 steps forward at a time. If you always face forward, the instructions suggest a backward and forward direction. Therefore, the answer is no.

Take 1 step forward. Take 7 steps right. Take 1 step left. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
There is one backwards step. The correct way to do this is to always face forward. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps backward. Take 10 steps right. Take 4 steps forward. Take 1 step left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 3 steps right. That is the longest you can go back forward. Take 3 steps right. That is the longest you can go left. So, the answer is no.
